intro: Reseda laevigata, commonly known as common reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with linear, glabrous leaves. Its flowers are pale yellow to white, often appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Reseda laevigata is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
